name: Judson Miller
text: Not a golf course. More like holes in the middle of the woods. No cart paths. Almost impossible to get a cart through the "course" I had to quit after 4 holes. The range was decent. Don't even think about playing here.  $20 is a complete rip off. I wouldn't pay $5

name: Eric Martin
text: Perfect place to work on your game without breaking the bank. A decent 18 holes for less than $20 w/cart? Not going to find that anywhere else in Birmingham.

name: Anthony Riley
text: The course is a goat track, range is usable but that's about it. For $5 you can hit a large bucket of balls which makes it worth the price but the course isn't even worth the $20 it costs to play it.

name: Anna Harmon
text:
So much fun. Beautiful land.

Great place to practice and be at peace.

name: Gregory Miller
text: From out of town,thought ut was a nice place perfect for driving 5.00 for a whole basket of balls felt like about 80 balls well worth going to practice driving

name: Scott Dobbs
text: Course is in poor condition. Literally, was teeing off next to a barn. Will not come back. Briars everywhere. Driving range is nice.

name: Drew Davis
text: Ok, first of all it is only 20$, so have a clue about where you are playing. It is a cheap and easy escape for a few hours, nice elevation but rough to play this is "country" golf. Owner and manger is very friendly, great range and fun quick 9 holes. I have played it several times, the briars are in the woods........not on the course. If you are a person looking to play some golf and in the B'ham area and you aren't hung up about rough golf this is the place.

name: Tim Perley
text: I hate that this great rustic 9 hole course with dramatic driving range is NOW CLOSED. SAD.
